se.softhouse.jargo

Class ArgumentBuilder.DefaultArgumentBuilder<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder<ArgumentBuilder.DefaultArgumentBuilder<T>,T>
      • se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder.DefaultArgumentBuilder<T>
  • Enclosing class:
    ArgumentBuilder<SELF extends ArgumentBuilder<SELF,T>,T>

    @NotThreadSafe
public static final class ArgumentBuilder.DefaultArgumentBuilder<T>
extends ArgumentBuilder<ArgumentBuilder.DefaultArgumentBuilder<T>,T>
    A very simple version of an ArgumentBuilder, it's exposed mainly to lessen the exposure of the SELF_TYPE argument of the ArgumentBuilder.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder

    • Method Detail

      • parser

        protected StringParser<T> parser()
        Description copied from class: ArgumentBuilder
         Returns a customized parser that the Argument will use to parse values.

 This is a suitable place to verify the configuration of your parser.

 If your StringParser doesn't support any configuration you can use
 Arguments.withParser(StringParser) directly instead of subclassing
 ArgumentBuilder

 @return the StringParser that performs the actual parsing of an argument value
 @throws IllegalStateException if the parser have been configured wrongly
        Specified by:
        parser in class ArgumentBuilder<ArgumentBuilder.DefaultArgumentBuilder<T>,T>
